page.title: 05Employment, Murroes
page.content: Although it is predominantly an agricultural area, the latest census indicated that only 14% of the working population in the Wellbank/Kellas area were employed in agriculture, 79% in other jobs, and 6% unemployed. This is indicative of a tendancy throughout the area. Apart from agriculture, the main local employers are two Haulage Contractors, two Blacksmiths/Engineers,and one firm of Coachbuilders. The workforces employed by these firms are quite small (e.g. two firms employ 14 people each), and most of the people work outside the area, mainly in Dundee. With continuing mechanisation of farm work there is little likelihood that this trend will be reversed.
